name: How to a raise a ticket at DevOps JIRA board.txt - Before you raise a request
description: This section explains an alternative way to raise a request or ticket on the DevOps JIRA board without directly accessing the JIRA website. It suggests using a Slack command (/devops-jira) from any Slack channel, which will summon a JIRA bot. The bot will then ask for details required to create the ticket, making the process more convenient and accessible from within the Slack workspace.
use_cases: Raising a request or ticket on the DevOps JIRA board
Accessing JIRA functionality from within Slack
Interacting with a JIRA bot to provide ticket details
capabilities: Slack command (/devops-jira) to summon JIRA bot
JIRA bot prompts for ticket details
Ability to raise JIRA requests without leaving Slack

Reporting an issue or requesting a feature related to DevOps processes or tools
Ensuring that the ticket is attention-grabbing and informative
Providing comprehensive details to facilitate efficient resolution

name: How to a raise a ticket at DevOps JIRA board.txt - It will ask for details like
description: This section explains the process of raising a ticket on the DevOps JIRA board. It provides details on the required fields to be filled out, such as the Environment (Production, Stage, or Perf), Business Unit (BU), and Category. These fields are presented as drop-down menus for easy selection. Additionally, it mentions that if the user is unsure about the BU or Category, they can seek assistance from their team or manager. The section also includes screenshots to visually guide the user through the process and illustrate the expected outcome, which is a notification sent to the respective DevOps Slack group.
use_cases: Raising a ticket on the DevOps JIRA board
Seeking assistance for selecting the appropriate BU or Category
Receiving notifications in the DevOps Slack group
capabilities: Drop-down menus for Environment, BU, and Category selection
Support from team or manager for field selection
